channel.title: Furex
channel.description:
I was a bit bored the last few days and began working on image i've had in my head for a while. I first sketched it on paper, and then recreated it. Its a very different style from my normal stuff, but I like the overall feel.
http://fc05.deviantart.com/fs23/f/2007/356/c/e/Furex_by_EnviedArt.png (All done in vector, no brushes touched)
Ill upload the sketch of it when i find my self with access to a scanner.
Please give comments and suggestions :). (Oh and before its mentioned, i know the text sucks, my attention span ran out.)

item.title: Furex
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:15, topic:166990”]So how did you do this? Pen tool? I really want to know your technique ;).

Also why when I try to go on your deviantart it comes up with

raphael.deviantart.com

Then i click on that and it doesn’t give me anything. Deviantart link please?[/quote]

enviedart.deviantart.com, this is the only thing on this DA account, I just made a new one. (I have a bad habit of keeping 1, I have 3 now I believe.)

For the right squiglies I made 3 jagged lines, and then had at it with copying, pasting, and warping. Its actually quite easy to tell that I just copied the lines over and over. For the left side I had 2 shapes aside from the circles.


I repeated the top shape 4 times on the left side, along with flipping around the bg/border colors.


To make the top shape and give it the contour-ish depth feel I simply: duplicated this shape, made it smaller (usually just by 1 pixel so I could get the thicker feel to it at spots), and warped a bit, over and over.

Then I just quick threw in some red for a little color.

Then the the shape between these and the squiglies was penned out, then I added just added some circles in the mix.

I’d say about 5% of this was pen tool, 5% circle tool, 90% copy, paste, resize, warp.

Read full topic

item.title: Furex
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

brownsymcard:

It depends on the DPI I use (dots/pixels per inch). Right now its at 72dpi (web standard), making it 2304x1728. I plan on increasing it to 300dpi which would make it a 9600x7200. It will all scale nicely, since Its all in vector. I do need to wait until Thursday to upscale it when my new parts for my computer arrive. Right now I only am using 512mbs of ram with a crap processor which cant handle large tasks too well. Thursday ill have a new motherboard, new e6850 processor, new en8800GT graphics card, and 4 gigs of ram.

Heh, I was handling a 9" by 11" yearbook cover with 300dpi… With an onboard chipset…

That was fucking HELL.

The TIFF was like 300mB :\

Read full topic

item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Sick of Air:

It’s vector, it’s not supposed to look like an ordinary object…

And I don’t like the way it is. I’m not saying I dislike everything abnormal.

Read full topic

item.title: Furex
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

I Br3ndan I:

I don’t really like it. To me, it just looks like a whole lot of things jumbled together meant to confuse the viewer or make them think about things personal to you. In other words, work out what symbolizes what.

It’s vector, it’s not supposed to look like an ordinary object…

brownsymcard:

It depends on the DPI I use (dots/pixels per inch). Right now its at 72dpi (web standard), making it 2304x1728. I plan on increasing it to 300dpi which would make it a 9600x7200. It will all scale nicely, since Its all in vector. I do need to wait until Thursday to upscale it when my new parts for my computer arrive. Right now I only am using 512mbs of ram with a crap processor which cant handle large tasks too well. Thursday ill have a new motherboard, new e6850 processor, new en8800GT graphics card, and 4 gigs of ram.

Nice. I have 1GB of ram and a 6 year old graphics card >.<

Read full topic

item.title: Furex
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

[quote=“Sick of Air, post:9, topic:166990”][quote author=brownsymcard link=topic=226342.msg1947591#msg1947591 date=1198389436]
Thanks

My goal by the end of Xmas break is to complete a 32x24 print I’ve been working on. Ill be sure to post it when I’m done.
[/quote]
What dimensions is that?[/quote]

It depends on the DPI I use (dots/pixels per inch). Right now its at 72dpi (web standard), making it 2304x1728. I plan on increasing it to 300dpi which would make it a 9600x7200. It will all scale nicely, since Its all in vector. I do need to wait until Thursday to upscale it when my new parts for my computer arrive. Right now I only am using 512mbs of ram with a crap processor which cant handle large tasks too well. Thursday ill have a new motherboard, new e6850 processor, new en8800GT graphics card, and 4 gigs of ram.

EDIT: At Brendan:

Normally when I create things I try to fill them with meaning/symbolism. This one has truly none to it. I had been experimenting with a few new techniques during this. As I get better at this style I will begin to implement more feelings/symbolism. Its just a bit hard when the only thing going though your mind is boredom and waiting for my parts to arrive in the mail.

Read full topic
